comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: A speculative long-shot.  Is this Nigel Anselm E Adams, born Dover, 1899?  No indication that he joined the Royal Navy though.//

comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content: Z/7170 Able Seaman Nigel Anselm Edward Adams served in the Royal Navy Volunteer Reserve from 1918.  Unlikely to be him.  Not a bad try though.  Scouring the Forces War Records site, but not having much success!  Probably safe to say that this man survived the war.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Then perhaps it is not N E Adams, but instead H E Adams, - perhaps Midshipman Harold Edward Adams who, in 1918, was a Sub-Lieutenant on HMS DANUBE II ?  This appears to have been a Royal Navy Rescue Tug.//

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Harold Edward Adams was born on 3rd September 1898.  He was Commissioned as a Midshipman in 1914, and completed his Royal Navy Service in the rank of Commander.  National Archive Record ADM 196/121/1.//

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
National Archives gives Nigel Anselm Edward Adams b. 06 Aug 1899 RNVR 
a 1917 record.

Nigel Anselm Edward Adams of 84 Carshalton Park Road, Carshalton, Surrey, Retired Insurance Clerk,
died 21st February1966.
